name: Research Project in Sociology
description: This is a seminar course where students engage in an independent research project supervised by a faculty member in Sociology. Students develop a research proposal, conduct independent research, analyze data and present findings. Admission by academic merit. Interested students should submit an application to the Department of Sociology (see website for details). Preference given to eligible Sociology Specialists and Majors.[24S]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, completed at least 13.0 credits, P.I.
